body.p:
To His Excellency James F Robinson
Governor of Kentucky,

The undersigned Citizens of Louisville Respectfully ask your Excellency to Pardon Calvin Fairbanks, who was in the Spring of 1852 Convicted & sentenced to Serve fifteen years in the Penitentiary for the Crime of aiding a Slave to escape from his owner
They State that from what they have heard of Fairbanks he was a monomaniac on the Subject of Slavery, at the time the offence was committed,
They believe the time he has been imprisoned a sufficient Punishment for the offence,
Wherefore they most respectfully ask that the ballance of his term be remitted

Jno. Homire
C. T. Taylor
A J Ballard
J. D. Osborne
M S Fields
R. E. North
S. A. Atchison
John N. Mattingly
Jeff Brown.
R, H, Rousseau

Calvin Fairbans has once heretofor received the Exetv. Clemency of Kenty and upon his release committed again the same Offence for which he was again asks pardon I do not think it should be granted
